intro: Bouvardia × oriana, commonly known as the Bouvardia or the Christmas Bouvardia, is a hybrid plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to South America and is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, featuring opposite, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in warm climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a potted plant. Bouvardia × oriana is relatively low-maintenance, requiring well-drained soil and full to partial sunlight.
